definition: signatory states/countries that are party to a treaty
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: China is a contracting party to the International Convention on the Harmonised Commodity Description and Coding System.
sentences.chinese: 我國是《商品名稱和編碼的協調製度公約》締約國。

sentences.english: States Parties shall render appropriate assistance to persons with disabilities in the performance of their child-rearing responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 締約國應當適當協助殘疾人履行其養育子女的責任。

sentences.english: It shall be subject to ratification or acceptance by the signatory States.
sentences.chinese: 公約失效須經各締約國的批准或接受。

sentences.english: The signatories also agreed to an unprecedented 10-year holiday in the construction of new capital ships.
sentences.chinese: 締約國還同意在今後十年內不建造新的主力艦。

sentences.english: These time-limited recommendations are made available to States and, subsequently, made public.
sentences.chinese: 上述有時間限定的建議應通報締約國，然後予以公開。

sentences.english: The ratifications shall be deposited at Brussels at a date to be fixed by agreement among the said Governments.
sentences.chinese: 批准書應於各締約國協商確定的日期交存於布魯塞爾。

sentences.english: Each signatory would have the right to trade in the vast China market.
sentences.chinese: 每個締約國都有權在遼闊的中國市場進行貿易。

sentences.english: WHO will collaborate with and support States in the implementation of the Regulations.
sentences.chinese: 世衛組織與締約國合作並支持締約國執行本條例。

sentences.english: WHO will collaborate with and support States in the implementation of the Regulations.
sentences.chinese: 世衛組織與締約國合作並支持締約國執行本條例。

definition: environmental impact assessment EIA/abbr. to 環評|环评
pinyin: huan2 jing4 ying3 xiang3 ping2 gu1

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
